1.title: The Series Finale

episode of.title: Every Day a Little Seth: The Web Series (TV Series 2010– )

1.plot: Seth thanks everyone for watching and explains his plans for adapting this series into a sitcom for TV.

1.title: I Like Her

episode of.title: Every Day a Little Seth: The Web Series (TV Series 2010– )

1.plot: In the pilot episode of "Every Day a Little Seth" Seth Bisen-Hersh sings his song "I Like Her" then details three minor infatuations he has had since being dumped two months ago.

2.title: Fuck Friends

episode of.title: Every Day a Little Seth: The Web Series (TV Series 2010– )

2.plot: Seth Bisen-Hersh sings his song "Fuck Friends" then discusses the complexities of attempting have sex with female friends.

3.title: If Only I Were Gay

episode of.title: Every Day a Little Seth: The Web Series (TV Series 2010– )

3.plot: In episode 3 of "Every Day a Little Seth" Seth Bisen-Hersh sings his song "If Only I Were Gay" then discusses his annoyance at society pigeonholing him as homosexual when he is not. (Seriously, he's not.)

4.title: In Love

episode of.title: Every Day a Little Seth: The Web Series (TV Series 2010– )

4.plot: In Episode 4 of Every Day a Little Seth, Broadway star Arbender Robinson sings Seth's romantic anthem, In Love, and then Seth shares his video dating profile detailing everything he would like in a girl. If you are (or know) an interested girl, please send him a message!

5.title: I'd Rather Take a Nap

episode of.title: Every Day a Little Seth: The Web Series (TV Series 2010– )

5.plot: In Episode 5 of Every Day a Little Seth, the incomparable Rori Nogee sings Seth's song, "I'd Rather Take a Nap", and then Seth and Rori share first date and first kiss horror and success stories.

6.title: I'm Not Interested in You

episode of.title: Every Day a Little Seth: The Web Series (TV Series 2010– )

6.plot: In the Season 1 Finale of Every Day a Little Seth, Broadway performer Olivia Oguma (Mamma Mia) sings Seth's song, "I'm Not Interested in You", and then Seth and guest star, Rori Nogee, tell stories about how to tell if someone IS interested in you.

1.title: OCD

episode of.title: Every Day a Little Seth: The Web Series (TV Series 2010– )

1.plot: In the Season 2 Premiere, Seth Bisen-Hersh sings his signature song, OCD, and then describes his own obsessive compulsions. Additionally, he interviews planted strangers on theirs, as well.

2.title: I'll Relax When I'm Dead

episode of.title: Every Day a Little Seth: The Web Series (TV Series 2010– )

2.plot: In Episode 8 of Every Day a Little Seth, Seth Bisen-Hersh sings his song, I'll Relax When I'm Dead, then talks about his workaholic, late night productivity. Furthermore, Rori Nogee describes a typical day in the life of a starving actress.

3.title: Subway Paranoia

episode of.title: Every Day a Little Seth: The Web Series (TV Series 2010– )

3.plot: In Episode 9 of Every Day a Little Seth, Seth Bisen-Hersh talks about his transportation woes with stories on the subway, the Bolt Bus and about flying China Eastern to Shanghai. Also, the episode features Erica Lindblad singing Seth's song: Subway Paranoia.

4.title: My HD TV

episode of.title: Every Day a Little Seth: The Web Series (TV Series 2010– )

4.plot: In Episode 10 of Every Day a Little Seth, Seth Bisen-Hersh talks about his entertainment options including a rant on Time Warner Cable, his DVR and his movie hopping escapades. Also, the episode features Brian Childers singing Seth's song: My HD TV.

5.title: I Need a Studio

episode of.title: Every Day a Little Seth: The Web Series (TV Series 2010– )

5.plot: In Episode 11 of Every Day a Little Seth, Seth Bisen-Hersh talks about his horrendous roommate experiences. Furthermore, Rori Nogee reveals her biggest roommate pet peeve, and the planted strangers return to tell roommate horror stories. Also, the episode features Gordon Maniskas singing Seth's song: I Need a Studio.

6.title: Smee

episode of.title: Every Day a Little Seth: The Web Series (TV Series 2010– )

6.plot: The Season 2 Finale, Episode 12 of Every Day a Little Seth, is all about Seth Bisen-Hersh's co-star, Smee. Stories include adopting Smee, how the Humane Society saved Smee's life, and a day in the life of Smee. The episode features a lot of Smee footage, some Smee montages, and Smee's jingle sung by Elyse Beyer.

1.title: Smart Phone

episode of.title: Every Day a Little Seth: The Web Series (TV Series 2010– )

1.plot: In Season 3 Premiere, Seth Bisen-Hersh sings Smart Phone and talks about why never wants to get one, how much he hates texting, and all about the Verizon Friends & Family plan.

2.title: Online Dating

episode of.title: Every Day a Little Seth: The Web Series (TV Series 2010– )

2.plot: In Episode 14, Online Dating, Seth Bisen-Hersh details his horrific experiences on okcupid and jdate. Next, Rori Nogee talks about a horrific date she had from okcupid... then proceeds to read actual letters from guys on that site. Finally, Seth returns with a story about the Bryant Park movies. All throughout, Nathan Freeman sings Seth's song "Dear CuteNTiny" and, of course, Smee makes an appearance during the moral.

3.title: My New Apartment

episode of.title: Every Day a Little Seth: The Web Series (TV Series 2010– )

3.plot: In Episode 15, Seth Bisen-Hersh gives a tour of his new apartment, interviews planted strangers on the street about their apartment, and talks about why he is scared of elevators and dogs... and especially dogs in elevators! Also, Jennifer Oman sings "The Last Night in My New Apartment" throughout the episode. Strangers on the street: Jason Green, Melanie Gretchen, Ilene Grossman, Betsy Houvouras, Teresa Hui, Aaron Kapner, Marcia Sofley, Jacob Thompson, Megan Tischhauser and Nick Walkonis.

4.title: My Favorite Holidays

episode of.title: Every Day a Little Seth: The Web Series (TV Series 2010– )

4.plot: In Episode 16, Seth Bisen-Hersh talks about his favorite holidays: April Fools Day & Halloween! Also, Rori Nogee tells hilarious tales of her Passover seder. Throughout, vintage footage of Seth singing "On Xmas It Sucks to be a Jew" reenforces the theme that there are many other holidays to celebrate!

5.title: Insomnia

episode of.title: Every Day a Little Seth: The Web Series (TV Series 2010– )

5.plot: In Episode 17, Seth Bisen-Hersh talks about his experience with chronic insomnia, then interviews planted strangers on the street about what keeps them up in night, and finally, in a segment directed by Rori Nogee relives a sleepless night with the help of his loveable sidecat, Smee. Throughout, Miriam Kushel sings Seth's song "Sleep Deprivation."

6.title: To My Grandparents

episode of.title: Every Day a Little Seth: The Web Series (TV Series 2010– )

6.plot: In the Season 3 finale, Seth talks about his 4 grandparents and how much they mean to him, sharing anecdotes, as well as telling 2 of their Holocaust stories. Vocals by Elyse Beyer throughout, and as always, Smee comes in to thank everyone for watching this season!

1.title: The MIT Mystery Hunt

episode of.title: Every Day a Little Seth: The Web Series (TV Series 2010– )

1.plot: In the Season 4 Premiere, Seth talks about an annual he's participated in since freshman year at MIT: The MIT Mystery Hunt! Find out all about its history, his hunt history: playing, writing and running a hunt (one of his life dreams)!

2.title: Survival Jobs

episode of.title: Every Day a Little Seth: The Web Series (TV Series 2010– )

2.plot: In Episode 20, Seth talks about all the survival jobs he's had over the years... the episode also features the incomparable Rori Nogee and random people on the street: Ilene Grossman, Betsy Houvouras, Teresa Hui, Aaron Kapner, Melissa Meli and Marcia Sofley. The episode also features Kristen Michelle singing Seth's song "So You Wanna Be a Performer" which is based on a blog by Rori Nogee about an actor's life.

3.title: Weddings

episode of.title: Every Day a Little Seth: The Web Series (TV Series 2010– )

3.plot: In Episode 21 Weddings, Seth sings "The Wedding Song" and then talks about all the weddings he's been to over the years, why he's still single and what it's like having friends with babies.

4.title: It's Not You, It's Me

episode of.title: Every Day a Little Seth: The Web Series (TV Series 2010– )

4.plot: In Episode 22, It's Not You, It's Me, Seth talks about what it is like breaking up with someone while offering some techniques. Also the episode features Ilene Grossman, Betsy Houvouras, Teresa Hui, Aaron Kapner, Melissa Meli and Marcia Sofley talking about their worst break ups. Finally, the episode includes a montage watching Seth go through the 5 stages of a break up directed by Joshua Desjardins. Seth's song "It's Not You, It's Me" is performed by Elly Noble. Finally, this episode's guest cat, Smee, pops up unexpectedly.

5.title: Social Media

episode of.title: Every Day a Little Seth: The Web Series (TV Series 2010– )

5.plot: In Episode 23, Social Media, Seth discusses his experiences with Facebook, Twitter and Instagram... Smee's Instagram. This is the episode this season with the most Smee. Throughout the stories, Kimberly Faye Greenberg sings Seth's song "Dear Facebook".

6.title: Dreams

episode of.title: Every Day a Little Seth: The Web Series (TV Series 2010– )

6.plot: In the season finale, Seth goes around town talking about the dreams he's accomplished and the dreams he still will accomplish. In the 2nd story, Rori Nogee, talks about when the reality of achieving dreams doesn't live up to the dream of them. In between stories, Karmine Alers sings Seth's song "Dreams" which sums up the whole season. Finally, Smee shows up to tell you to keep dreaming... and meowing.

1.title: Love Quirks

episode of.title: Every Day a Little Seth: The Web Series (TV Series 2010– )

1.plot: In the Season 5 premiere, Seth is joined by the cast and director of his musical, Love Quirks, which had a successful 3 week run Off-Off-Broadway September 2014.

2.title: Too Much TV

episode of.title: Every Day a Little Seth: The Web Series (TV Series 2010– )

2.plot: In Episode 26, Too Much TV, Seth performs his song "Too Much TV" and reveals why he still has cable, then discusses his epic switch from TWC to FiOS! Additionally, he interviews planted strangers on the street about their guilty pleasure TV shows.

3.title: Auditions

episode of.title: Every Day a Little Seth: The Web Series (TV Series 2010– )

3.plot: In Episode 27, Auditions, Seth performs his song "The Audition Pianist Lament" and describes the audition process, including some valuable advice for actors. Rori Nogee recounts her most embarrassing audition and the episode ends with a must-see hilarious montage of the Worst. Auditions. Ever.

4.title: TV and Radio

episode of.title: Every Day a Little Seth: The Web Series (TV Series 2010– )

4.plot: In Episode 28 Seth sings some fake jingles he wrote for a reality show he was on that never aired. Then, he talks about his attempts to be on TV over the years, his actual times on radio including his almost win on NPR's Ask Me Another and divulges all about his reality show experience.

5.title: I'm So Sorry

episode of.title: Every Day a Little Seth: The Web Series (TV Series 2010– )

5.plot: In Episode 29 Seth talks about his unfortunate habit of putting his foot in his mouth and his methods for apologizing, practicing on Smee. He also interviews planted strangers on the street about their worst faux pas. This is all juxtaposed with Brian Childers singing Seth's song "I'm So Sorry."

6.title: Vacations

episode of.title: Every Day a Little Seth: The Web Series (TV Series 2010– )

6.plot: In Episode 30, the season 5 finale, Seth sings his song "I Hate Nature" about a vacation to Oregon and then talks about his experiences in Shanghai, Ireland, Copenhagen, Germany and Paris. The episode contains 120 pictures from his travels and is filled with humorous anecdotes and cultural musings.

imdb.plot outline: In every episode, Seth (or one of his performer friends) sings one of his songs that becomes the theme. Then he tells three hilarious stories (or sometimes interviews friends or does crazy montages) and eventually discusses the moral of each episode with his cat, Smee. Topics include many facets of dating, apartments, survival jobs and following one's Broadway/TV dreams.
imdb.title: Every Day a Little Seth: The Web Series
akas: Every Day a Little Seth: The Web Series (United States)
plot: In every episode, Seth (or one of his performer friends) sings one of his songs that becomes the theme. Then he tells three hilarious stories (or sometimes interviews friends or does crazy montages) and eventually discusses the moral of each episode with his cat, Smee. Topics include many facets of dating, apartments, survival jobs and following one's Broadway/TV dreams.
